scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of an one-page typed letter, with envelope, February 24, 1961, signed by David Gray (1870-1968), Sarasota, Florida, to Peggy Kellem [Mrs. Robert Kellem], East Chatham, New York. Gray thanks Kellem for the gift of the book, The Longest Dayabout which he says, "Reading it was the experience of the winter, magnified by the fact that one of the 82nd Airborne who was behind the lines all that 'longest' night was actually in the room talking to me." He also mentions the appointment of General [James M.] Gavin as Ambassador to France. Brigadier General James Maurice Gavin led the assault of the 82nd Airborne Division during the "longest day" of World War II, June 6, 1944.
